metadata.title: CVE-2016-6259 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Xen 4.5.x through 4.7.x do not implement Supervisor Mode Access Prevention(SMAP) whitelisting in 32-bit exception and event delivery, which allowslocal 32-bit PV guest OS kernels to cause a denial of service (hypervisorand VM crash) by triggering a safety check.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6259` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxen-4.6 - 4.6.0-1ubuntu4.2
libxenstore3.0 - 4.6.0-1ubuntu4.2
xen-hypervisor-4.4-amd64 - 4.6.0-1ubuntu4.2
xen-hypervisor-4.4-arm64 - 4.6.0-1ubuntu4.2
xen-hypervisor-4.4-armhf - 4.6.0-1ubuntu4.2
xen-hypervisor-4.5-amd64 - 4.6.0-1ubuntu4.2
xen-hypervisor-4.5-arm64 - 4.6.0-1ubuntu4.2
xen-hypervisor-4.5-armhf - 4.6.0-1ubuntu4.2
xen-hypervisor-4.6-amd64 - 4.6.0-1ubuntu4.2
xen-hypervisor-4.6-arm64 - 4.6.0-1ubuntu4.2
xen-hypervisor-4.6-armhf - 4.6.0-1ubuntu4.2
xen-system-amd64 - 4.6.0-1ubuntu4.2
xen-system-arm64 - 4.6.0-1ubuntu4.2
xen-system-armhf - 4.6.0-1ubuntu4.2
xen-utils-4.6 - 4.6.0-1ubuntu4.2
xen-utils-common - 4.6.0-1ubuntu4.2
xenstore-utils - 4.6.0-1ubuntu4.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xen package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.6.0-1ubuntu4.2').
